blocks.name: metcnp3
blocks.content: Two ways to express that ` F ` is continuous at ` P ` for metric spaces. Proposition 14-4.2 of [Gleason] p. 240. (Contributed by NM, 17-May-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2015.)

blocks.content: Two ways to say a mapping from metric ` C ` to metric ` D ` is continuous at point ` P ` . (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2015.)

  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)

  a1ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cxmet, c3)), wcel(c4, c1)), wb(wcel(c5, cfv(co(c6, ccnp, c7), c4)), wa(wf(c5, c1, c3), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, crp, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(co(c4, c0, cv(s2)), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(co(cfv(c5, c4), c2, cfv(c5, cv(s2))), clt, cv(s0))))))))), diffsc(s2, c6))

blocks.name: metcnp2
blocks.content: Two ways to say a mapping from metric ` C ` to metric ` D ` is continuous at point ` P ` . The distance arguments are swapped compared to ~ metcnp (and Munkres' ~ metcn ) for compatibility with ~ df-lm . Definition 1.3-3 of [Kreyszig] p. 20. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm metcnp2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cxmet, c3)), wcel(c4, c1)), wb(wcel(c5, cfv(co(c6, ccnp, c7), c4)), wa(wf(c5, c1, c3), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, crp, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(co(cv(s2), c0, c4), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(co(cfv(c5, cv(s2)), c2, cfv(c5, c4)), clt, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cmopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cmopn, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)
} = {
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cxmet, c3)), wcel(c4, c1)), wcel(c5, cfv(co(c6, ccnp, c7), c4)), wa(wf(c5, c1, c3), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, crp, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(co(cv(s2), c0, c4), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(co(cfv(c5, cv(s2)), c2, cfv(c5, c4)), clt, cv(s0))))))), wa(wf(c5, c1, c3), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, crp, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(co(c4, c0, cv(s2)), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(co(cfv(c5, c4), c2, cfv(c5, cv(s2))), clt, cv(s0))))))))

blocks.name: metcn
blocks.content: Two ways to say a mapping from metric ` C ` to metric ` D ` is continuous. Theorem 10.1 of [Munkres] p. 127. The second biconditional argument says that for every positive "epsilon" ` y ` there is a positive "delta" ` z ` such that a distance less than delta in ` C ` maps to a distance less than epsilon in ` D ` . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm metcn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {

  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cmopn, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)

  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)

  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)

  impr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cxmet, c3))), wcel(c4, cfv(co(c5, ccnp, c6), c7)), wcel(c8, crp), wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(co(c7, c0, cv(s1)), clt, cv(s0)), wbr(co(cfv(c4, c7), c2, cfv(c4, cv(s1))), clt, c8)))))
  simpl2im(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cxmet, c3))), wcel(c4, cfv(co(c5, ccnp, c6), c7))), wi(wcel(c8, crp), wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(co(c7, c0, cv(s1)), clt, cv(s0)), wbr(co(cfv(c4, c7), c2, cfv(c4, cv(s1))), clt, c8))))), wf(c4, c1, c3), wral(hs0, crp, wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(co(c7, c0, cv(s1)), clt, cv(s0)), wbr(co(cfv(c4, c7), c2, cfv(c4, cv(s1))), clt, cv(hs0)))))))
